page.title: 06Chatteris - Horseway Lock
page.content: Horseway Lock is situated on Vermuden's Drain between Horseway Bridge and the River Ouse. It was constructed between 1844 and 1848 as part of the drainage and waterways system. It was hoped that its use would help to clear the waterways of the constant problem of silt build up and weed growth. Gradually the drain and lock fell into dis-use and the drain had no traffic. No boats go up and down this stretch of the Ouse any more. The drain has become very over grown especially on the North side of the lock, which is completely impassable. This stretch is administered by the Great Ouse Water Authority and they have not cleared the drain. Although the lock has been renewed between the rivers Nene and Ouse.
